isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 5000 9100 9200 9400 9900 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - GAUGES AND WARNING LIGHTS - 5000, 5000i, 9000, 9000i - DESCRIPTION - GAUGES

svcprocinfo.para: This service section refers to electronic gauges, electrical gauges, and mechanical gauges.

svcsubproc.title: Electronic Gauges
svcsubproc.para: The electronic gauges are the speedometer, tachometer, engine oil pressure, engine water temperature, voltmeter and fuel level. These gauges are 4-pin (electrical gauges are 3-pin) and operate on low voltages supplied by the Speedometer/Tachometer module microprocessor.

An optional Speedometer/Tachometer unit is available that includes a digital odometer/hourmeter as opposed to the standard mechanical odometer. The digital unit has four operating modes to display: total miles, trip miles, engine hours and trip hours.

svcsubproc.title: Electrical Gauges
svcsubproc.para: The 3-pin gauges in this group operate on 12 volts and are connected directly to the gauge sender. Gauges in this group include engine oil temperature, (front) rear axle temperature, (rear) rear axle temperature and transmission oil temperature.
The exhaust temperature (pyrometer) gauge, also included in this section, is an electrical gauge, but has its own control module (signal amplifier).

svcsubproc.title: Mechanical Gauges
svcsubproc.para: The air pressure gauges are mechanical. The gauge movement is caused by air pressure. Gauges in this group include air 1 pressure, air 2 pressure, and air application.
